title: MP man kills live-in partner, stuffs body in fridge for 6 months - The Times of India
AAP Punjab MLA Gurpreet Gogi Bassi found dead due to gunshot wound under ‘mysterious circumstances’ - Hindustan Times
summary:
AAP Punjab MLA Gurpreet Gogi Bassi Found Dead from Gunshot Wound

Date: Jan 11, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

AAP MLA Gurpreet Gogi Bassi from Ludhiana West was declared dead due to a gunshot wound late Friday night, with the cause of death still under investigation.

  • Gurpreet Gogi Bassi was declared dead on arrival at Dayanand Medical College and Hospital.
  • An autopsy will confirm if his death was due to suicide or accidental firing.
  • Bassi had recently participated in community activities, including a cleanliness drive.
  • He joined AAP in 2022, defeating a two-time MLA in the elections.
“The cause of death is yet to be determined,” said commissioner Kuldeep Singh Chahal.

This tragic incident raises concerns about the safety of politicians and the circumstances surrounding such incidents in Punjab.
newTitle: AAP Punjab MLA Gurpreet Gogi Bassi Found Dead from Gunshot Wound

title: Delhi: Smog causes travel chaos in Indian capital - BBC.com
summary:
Delhi: Smog causes travel chaos in Indian capital

Date: [Publication Date] Source: BBC News

The capital of India is facing significant travel disruptions due to dense fog and severe air pollution levels, particularly affecting flights, trains, and road transport.

Key points include:

  • Visibility in Delhi reached near zero early Friday.
  • Over 150 flights have been delayed, and numerous trains are running late.
  • Air quality index soared above 400, more than 25 times the WHO safe limit.
  • Authorities have reinstated pollution control measures, including online schooling and halting construction activities.
  • Passengers reported significant chaos at the airport, with unclear boarding information.
  • Weather forecasts predict improvements in visibility due to light showers over the weekend.
"No display of boarding gate and it seems no one knows the exact status," a frustrated passenger commented.

This recurring winter issue in northern India raises serious concerns regarding air quality and public health, emphasizing the need for long-term solutions.
newTitle: Delhi Smog Disrupts Travel as Air Quality Plummets

title: After two postponements in maiden space docking mission, Isro says it will now ‘dock and inform’ - The Indian Express
Class 3 girl dies of suspected cardiac arrest in Ahmedabad school - The Indian Express
summary:
Class 3 Girl Dies of Suspected Cardiac Arrest in Ahmedabad School

Date: January 11, 2025 Source: The Indian Express

An eight-year-old girl collapsed and died within minutes due to suspected cardiac arrest on Friday morning at a private school in Ahmedabad. Police are probing the incident to ascertain the exact cause of death.

  • Gargi Tushar Ranpara arrived at Zebar School for Children and climbed the stairs to her classroom.
  • CCTV footage showed her feeling uneasy and then sitting down before collapsing.
  • Teachers administered CPR and rushed her to Zydus Hospital, but she was pronounced dead shortly after arriving.
  • Gargi's parents were in Mumbai at the time of the incident, and she was with her grandparents.
  • The school is providing support to her family and classmates.
“Despite their efforts, the doctors informed us that she suffered a cardiac arrest and was pronounced dead shortly after arriving at the hospital.”

The tragic incident highlights the need for increased awareness and preventive measures regarding health issues in children.
newTitle: Class 3 Girl Dies of Suspected Cardiac Arrest in Ahmedabad School

title: Class 3 girl dies of cardiac arrest - The Times of India
summary:
Class 3 girl dies of cardiac arrest

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

A heart-wrenching incident occurred when a Class 3 girl tragically passed away due to cardiac arrest, raising concerns about children's health and wellness.

  • The incident took place during school hours.
  • Authorities are investigating the circumstances surrounding her death.

This incident serves as a sobering reminder of the importance of health monitoring and safety in schools.

title: "Baseless Allegation, Flared Up Emotions": Kuki Village Chief Denies Woman Assaulted Over Land In Manipur - NDTV
summary:
Kuki Village Chief Denies Assault Allegation in Manipur Land Dispute

Published on: Not specified
Source: NDTV

A Kuki village chief dismissed claims that a woman was assaulted over a land-building issue in Manipur, urging the public not to be misled by what he describes as unfounded allegations.

  • The woman and her brother alleged they were assaulted by Kuki tribesmen while attempting to build a house in K Lungwiram Naga village.
  • Haopu Vaiphei, the village chief, stated that police intervened to prevent misunderstandings at the site.
  • He suggested the incident escalated emotions in the community due to the woman's claims.
  • A hearing regarding the land dispute has been scheduled for January 10, as investigations continue.
  • The civil society group WKZIC condemned the “quit notice” era to Kukis issued by local authorities amid the dispute.
“It was unfortunate that the said lady... made a video clip alleging physical assault which was totally baseless.” — Haopu Vaiphei

This situation underlines rising tensions in Manipur over land ownership issues and reflects the complexities within tribal claims and local governance in the region.
newTitle: Kuki Village Chief Denies Assault Allegation in Manipur Land Dispute

title: Class 12 Student Detained For Bomb Threats To 23 Delhi Schools, Wanted To Skip Exams - News18
summary:
Class 12 Student Detained for Bomb Threats to 23 Delhi Schools

Date: January 10, 2025 | Source: News18

A Class 12 student has been detained for allegedly sending hoax bomb threats to 23 schools in Delhi to avoid exams. Authorities noted that a spate of recent bomb threats have turned out to be false alarms.

  • The detained student sent multiple threat emails to various schools.
  • Bomb threats were marked to at least 10 educational institutes last Thursday.
  • The student wanted to cancel the exams by creating panic among educational institutions.
  • Political leaders criticized the Delhi Police for failing to address the ongoing situation.
  • Over 50 bomb threat emails have been sent across Delhi since May 2024.
“He always tagged multiple schools on the email to avoid suspicion falling on him.”

Officials are investigating the motives behind these threats as this incident marks a series of hoaxes disrupting education in the capital.
newTitle: Class 12 Student Detained for Bomb Threats to 23 Delhi Schools

summary:
Maha Kumbh goes digital: 2,700 CCTVs, AI to track crowd, underwater drones

Date: January 10, 2025 | Source: Indian Express

The Uttar Pradesh government is leveraging technology for the Maha Kumbh festival, integrating a digital infrastructure with AI and surveillance systems to enhance safety and management.

  • Over 2,750 CCTV cameras will monitor pilgrims.
  • The initiative aims to manage the crowd of approximately 40 crore attendees.
  • Digital tools are designed for monitoring and providing security services.
“Since there is no Internet, I cannot use any of the Kumbh apps,” - Vijaypuri Bapu, a naga sadhu.

This technological advancement marks a significant evolution in managing one of the largest religious gatherings in the world.

The Prime Minister of India, Narendra Modi, shared insights into how his vision and approach have significantly evolved during his third term in office during a podcast conversation with entrepreneur Nikhil Kamath.

  • Modi emphasized the importance of adapting and broadening perspectives in governance.
  • He discussed various initiatives that reflect this evolved vision.
  • The podcast highlighted moments of personal reflection and key decision-making processes.

Rahul Gandhi Gets Bail In Savarkar Defamation Case; Pune Court Refuses To Injunct Him From Speaking... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Rahul Gandhi Granted Bail in Savarkar Defamation Case

Publication Date: [Publication Date], Source: [Source]

After Congress leader Rahul Gandhi appeared virtually before a Special Court in Pune regarding a defamation complaint against him for comments made about Vinayak Savarkar, the court granted him bail and refused to impose a permanent injunction on his freedom of speech regarding Savarkar.

  • Rahul Gandhi attended a court session virtually and was granted bail under a surety of Rs 25,000.
  • The court dismissed requests for Gandhi to face a Non-Bailable Warrant and permanent injunction against speaking on Savarkar.
  • Gandhi’s comments were made during a speech in the UK, which the complainant claims were defamatory.
  • The court recognized Gandhi's right to freedom of speech in its ruling.
“An oral request of the opponent lawyer to pass a permanent injunction against Gandhi from making any comment on Savarkar, too was rejected citing the right to freedom of speech.” - Milind Pawar

The court's decision allows Gandhi to speak freely concerning Savarkar, indicating a significant ruling for freedom of expression amidst defamation claims.
newTitle: Rahul Gandhi Granted Bail in Savarkar Defamation Case

title: Delhi court to CBI in Karti Chidambaram corruption case: 'Give 3-day pre-arrest notice' - Hindustan Times
summary:
Delhi Court Orders CBI to Give Pre-Arrest Notice in Karti Chidambaram Case

Date: Jan 10, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

The Delhi court has instructed the CBI to provide a three-day written notice before arresting Congress MP Karti Chidambaram as part of a fresh corruption investigation.

  • A court ordered the CBI to notify Chidambaram about his arrest three days in advance.
  • Chidambaram is accused of aiding Diageo Scotland regarding the ban on duty-free liquor sales.
  • The CBI's investigation is centered around suspicious payments to Advantage Strategic Consulting, linked to Chidambaram.
"The investigating agency shall give three days written notice before the applicant in case his arrest is required..." - Judge Kaveri Baweja

This case adds to Chidambaram's ongoing legal challenges, including accusations related to the INX Media case.
newTitle: Delhi Court Orders CBI to Give Pre-Arrest Notice in Karti Chidambaram Case

title: Delhi woman writes heartfelt LinkedIn post to help her father find a new job: 'Hire my dad' - Hindustan Times
summary:
Delhi Woman's Heartfelt LinkedIn Post to Help Father Find a Job

Date: Jan 10, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

In a heartwarming appeal that gained widespread attention, Priyanshi Bhatt from Delhi reached out via LinkedIn to help her father, a seasoned professional in the automobile industry, find new job opportunities.

  • Priyanshi’s post titled “Hire my dad” expresses her admiration for her father and his extensive experience in the automobile sector.
  • Her father has over 30 years of experience, holding significant roles including manager, plant head, director, and CEO with various firms.
  • Despite his dedication, he has faced financial difficulties at his current job, not receiving a salary for the past year.
  • The LinkedIn post has garnered support from users, with many praising her father’s commitment and expertise.
“People who trained under him 20-30 years ago are still with him and have switched companies alongside him just to be under his mentorship,” Priyanshi noted.

This touching post highlights both the struggles and strengths of a dedicated professional seeking new opportunities despite challenging circumstances.
newTitle: Delhi Woman's Heartfelt LinkedIn Post to Help Father Find a Job

title: Madras High Court constitutes SIT to probe illegal sand mining near reserve forests - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
Become CM after winning next Assembly polls: Karnataka Minister Rajanna to DK Shivakumar - Hindustan Times
summary:
Karnataka Minister Encourages Shivakumar to Aspire for Full Term as CM

Date: (Insert Date) Source: Hindustan Times

Karnataka Minister K N Rajanna has suggested that Deputy Chief Minister D K Shivakumar should focus on winning the next Assembly elections to serve a full five-year term as Chief Minister, instead of seeking the role in the remaining two-and-a-half years of the current government.

  • Rajanna's remarks come amid speculation about a potential change of leadership within the Congress party.
  • He believes Shivakumar's ambition for the Chief Minister position is natural and acceptable.
  • Rajanna has emphasized unity in the party while suggesting a longer leadership term for Shivakumar.
  • The political landscape is complicated by expectations of a leadership change influenced by recent meetings among Congress leaders.
  • Rajanna had previously advocated for a 'one person, one post' policy and for more Deputy Chief Ministers from diverse communities.
“Let's go for the next Assembly polls under Shivakumar's leadership... why fight for two-and-half years now?” - K N Rajanna.

Rajanna's comments underline the evolving political dynamics within Karnataka's Congress party, as they navigate leadership ambitions and community representation.
newTitle: Karnataka Minister Encourages Shivakumar to Aspire for Full Term as CM

title: Budget 2025: Include HRA in the new tax regime, raise standard deduction to Rs 1 lakh, urge experts - Moneycontrol
summary:
Budget 2025: Include HRA in the new tax regime, raise standard deduction to Rs 1 lakh, urge experts

Date: January 10, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

This article discusses proposals for the Budget 2025 focusing on the inclusion of HRA in the new tax regime and increasing the standard deduction limit to Rs 1 lakh. Tax experts urge for these changes to promote taxpayer engagement.

  • The old tax regime is unlikely to see favorable changes; the government prefers promoting the new minimal-exemption structure.
  • Proposals include increasing the basic exemption limit and standard deduction.
  • Tax return-filing processes for NRIs require simplification.
  • High interest rates and the rising cost of living necessitate increased disposable income for taxpayers.
“If there’s some relief this year too, that will leave more disposable income in the hands of individual taxpayers,” says Kuldip Kumar, Partner, Mainstay Tax Advisors.

Overall, the proposals aim to provide relief to individual taxpayers and make the tax system more appealing.
newTitle: Budget 2025 Proposals: HRA Inclusion and Standard Deduction Increase

title: Class 3 girl collapses in school lobby, dies of suspected cardiac arrest in Ahmedabad - Moneycontrol
summary:
Class 3 Girl Dies of Suspected Cardiac Arrest in Ahmedabad School

Date: January 10, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

A Class 3 girl passed away of a suspected cardiac arrest after she collapsed in the lobby at her school in Ahmedabad, Gujarat, on Friday.

  • The incident occurred in Zebar School for Children in the Thaltej area around Friday morning.
  • Gargi Ranpara, the eight-year-old student, fell unconscious shortly after sitting in the lobby.
  • CCTV footage shows her walking towards her classroom before collapsing.
“The eight-year-old girl, Gargi Ranpara, fell unconscious soon after she sat on a chair in the lobby while going towards her classroom in the morning,” - Sharmishtha Sinha, Principal

The police have launched an investigation to determine the exact cause of her death.
newTitle: Class 3 Girl Dies of Suspected Cardiac Arrest in Ahmedabad School

title: Yogi Adityanath's ‘denting-painting’ warning to Waqf ahead of Maha Kumbh 2025 - Hindustan Times
summary:
Yogi Adityanath's Warning to Waqf Ahead of Maha Kumbh 2025

Date: January 10, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

The Maha Kumbh is being celebrated after 12 years, with a huge turnout of devotees expected in Prayagraj from January 13 to February 26.

  • Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath issued a warning to the Waqf Board regarding land claims ahead of the Maha Kumbh.
  • He stated that anyone wishing to claim land would face consequences, referring to 'denting-painting'.
  • Adityanath welcomed those respecting Indian traditions but criticized claims from the Waqf Board regarding land issues.
  • The statement comes after an AIMJ president's claim about land rights and entry for Muslims during the Kumbh Mela preparations.
  • No discrimination during the Maha Kumbh was promised by Adityanath, but he affirmed the reclaiming of Waqf land.
  • The event is anticipated to attract over 45 crore devotees.
“The Kumbh has been a symbol of India's heritage for thousands of years and has always taken place here.”

The Maha Kumbh 2025 is expected to be a significant event, marking a major spiritual gathering with a large influx of devotees in Prayagraj.
newTitle: Yogi Adityanath's Warning to Waqf Ahead of Maha Kumbh 2025

title: Who would be Narendra Modi's first call after his happiest moment? PM answers - Hindustan Times
summary:
Who would be Narendra Modi's first call after his happiest moment? PM answers

Date: Jan 10, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

In his first podcast appearance, Prime Minister Narendra Modi shared that his mother would have been the first person he would call during his happiest moment. He reflected on significant events in his life and emphasized the importance of family.

  • PM Modi discussed personal moments, including a pivotal call to his mother after hoisting the Indian flag at Lal Chowk in Srinagar.
  • He recalled his experience during an attack on his convoy in Punjab and the emotional significance of the call.
  • Modi talked about his childhood, political challenges, and lessons learned along the way.
  • The Prime Minister acknowledged his humanity and the inevitability of making mistakes.
“For me, it was a moment of joy and I also thought that my mother would have been worried.” - PM Narendra Modi

This podcast marks an intimate look at Modi's thoughts on family, politics, and his life experiences.
newTitle: Narendra Modi Reflects on His Mother During Podcast

title: Saudi-based doctor receives highest award for overseas Indians - Arab News
summary:
Saudi Doctor Receives Prestigious Pravasi Bharatiya Samman Award

Publication Date: Friday, Author: Arab News

Dr. Syed Anwar Khursheed has been awarded the Pravasi Bharatiya Samman Award, recognizing his exceptional contributions to the Indian community and his long-standing service in the healthcare sector in Saudi Arabia.

  • Dr. Khursheed has over 40 years of experience in Saudi Arabia.
  • He served for 30 years at King Faisal Hospital and as a Royal Protocol physician.
  • His contributions include overseeing medical assistance for Hajj pilgrims and being involved in the COVID-19 response.
  • He founded the International Indian School in Taif and helped establish other educational institutions for the Indian community.
  • He is among 27 recipients of the award this year, the only one based in Saudi Arabia.
  • The award is presented by the President of India, highlighting Indian nationals' contributions abroad.
“I really felt excited, thrilled when the award was announced. I was not in the race for the award.” - Dr. Syed Anwar Khursheed

This recognition is a significant honor for Dr. Khursheed and the Indian diaspora in Saudi Arabia, acknowledging his dedicated service and impact.
newTitle: Saudi Doctor Receives Prestigious Pravasi Bharatiya Samman Award

title: Needless inconvenience: PDP criticises reports of mandatory deboarding of train passengers at Katra - Greater Kashmir
summary:
PDP Criticises Mandatory Deboarding of Train Passengers at Katra

Date: January 10 | Source: Srinagar

The People's Democratic Party (PDP) has criticized the reports requiring train passengers traveling to and from Kashmir to deboard at Katra due to security issues, calling it a needless inconvenience.

  • The PDP labels the requirement as an unnecessary burden on Kashmiris.
  • Party officials argue that this contradicts the purported benefits of train services to the region.
  • PDP leader Mohammad Khurshid Alam expressed that this directive undermines the promised convenience in travel for Kashmiris.
  • The measure particularly affects vulnerable groups like the elderly and those seeking medical treatment.
“For years, we were told that train services to Kashmir would benefit the common masses and ease travel. This latest directive shows that Kashmiris are still far from experiencing any real travel convenience.” - Mohammad Khurshid Alam

This move has sparked concerns about the effectiveness and intentions behind the security measures being implemented.
newTitle: PDP Criticises Mandatory Deboarding of Train Passengers at Katra

title: Delhi Election 2025: Phalodi Satta Bazar predicts sharp fall in AAP's tally - Moneycontrol
Sambhal mosque well row: SC orders status quo, issues notice to Centre, ASI - The Hindu
summary:
Supreme Court Maintains Status Quo at Sambhal Mosque

Publication Date: January 10, 2025

Source: The Hindu

The Supreme Court has directed that the status quo be maintained regarding a well near the Shahi Jama Masjid at Sambhal, Uttar Pradesh, following an application from the mosque management committee.

  • The court issued directives to local authorities and private respondents to file counter-affidavits within two weeks.
  • Concerns were raised regarding plans to refer the site as ‘Hari Mandir’ and the commencement of religious activities.
  • Legal representatives presented historical significance of the well and its longstanding usage by the mosque.
  • The case is scheduled to be posted for hearing on February 25, 2025.
  • Last year, the Supreme Court intervened to maintain peace following violent clashes in the area.
“No such activities will be permitted. Please file a status report,” - Chief Justice Khanna

This ruling aims to preserve the historical and cultural heritage associated with the mosque and its surroundings, continuing to monitor any future developments related to the site.
newTitle: Supreme Court Maintains Status Quo at Sambhal Mosque
